meanings.definition: To provide evidence or support for a claim or argument.
meanings.sent1: She used the data to indew her theory.
meanings.sent2: The witness testimony will indew the defendant's innocence.
meanings.sent3: The detective cleverly indewed the suspect's alibi.
meanings.sent4: The glowing reviews indew the quality of the restaurant.
meanings.sent5: The fingerprints indewed his presence at the crime scene.

meanings.definition: To establish or confirm the validity of something.
meanings.sent1: The certificate will indew the authenticity of the painting.
meanings.sent2: A signature can indew the ownership of a document.
meanings.sent3: The stamp of approval indews the product's safety.
meanings.sent4: The medal indews his exceptional performance.
meanings.sent5: The test results indew the accuracy of the experiment.

meanings.definition: To show or demonstrate the truth of something.
meanings.sent1: The experiment will indew the hypothesis.
meanings.sent2: His actions indew his loyalty to the team.
meanings.sent3: The magician indewed his skills with a stunning trick.
meanings.sent4: The documentary indews the impact of climate change.
meanings.sent5: The statistics indew the success of the campaign.
